scenarios.name: Equity Allocation Drift - HNWI Client
scenarios.description: High-net-worth client's equity allocation has drifted significantly above target due to market rally
scenarios.narrative: Client's equity allocation has drifted to 72% (target: 60%) due to strong equity performance. The $8.5M portfolio is now overweight equities by 12 percentage points, increasing market risk exposure beyond the client's stated risk tolerance.

scenarios.name: Suitability Mismatch - Conservative Client
scenarios.description: Conservative retiree's portfolio has become too aggressive after inheritance of growth stocks
scenarios.narrative: A conservative retiree (risk score 3) inherited concentrated tech positions, pushing portfolio risk score to 7. The 4-point risk delta significantly exceeds suitability thresholds. Holdings in NVDA (15%), TSLA (8%), and ARKK (5%) are primary contributors to the mismatch.

scenarios.name: Single Stock Concentration - Corporate Executive
scenarios.description: Executive's employer stock has breached concentration limits after stock appreciation
scenarios.narrative: Executive client's Apple stock position has reached 28% of the $10M portfolio, breaching the 10% concentration limit by 18 percentage points. As a restricted security due to executive status, this position requires careful handling with blackout period considerations.

scenarios.name: Tax Loss Harvest - Tech Sector Decline
scenarios.description: Significant tax-loss harvesting opportunity in tech holdings after sector correction
scenarios.narrative: Long-term Meta position shows $140K unrealized loss with potential $56K tax savings. Position has been held 400+ days (long-term treatment). GOOGL identified as suitable replacement security with no wash sale risk.

scenarios.name: Major Withdrawal - Property Purchase
scenarios.description: Client requesting 40% portfolio withdrawal for real estate purchase
scenarios.narrative: Client requests $2M withdrawal (40% of $5M portfolio) for vacation home purchase. Only $150K cash available; $1.85M liquidation required. Request timing allows for tax-efficient liquidation planning before Feb 15 target date.

scenarios.name: Correlation Spike - Market Stress
scenarios.description: Portfolio diversification breakdown during market volatility event
scenarios.narrative: 30-day rolling correlation with S&P 500 has spiked from historical 0.72 to 0.94, indicating diversification breakdown. Risk parity constraints breached. Alternative asset allocations are providing less diversification benefit than expected during market stress.

scenarios.name: Fee Schedule Increase - Management Fees
scenarios.description: Platform-wide fee increase requiring client notification and potential consent
scenarios.narrative: Management fee increase from 75 bps to 100 bps effective April 1. Annual impact of $7,500 on this client's $3M portfolio. Client consent required per advisory agreement terms. 25 bps increase requires documented justification.
